title: China Binges on U.S. Gas to Manage Energy Shortage, Carbon Footprint
sub_head: Record U.S. liquefied natural gas exports to China contrast to just a couple of years ago during the trade war
body:
At the height of the trade war in 2019, China all but cut off imports of U.S. liquefied natural gas. Today, China is buying more gas from the U.S. than ever.
The turnabout is one consequence of the global energy shortage that has sent prices soaring. And it is a result of Chinaâ€™s effort to cut carbon emissions by reducing how much coal it burns.
